title: Money & Wealth - South China Morning Post
description: Financial news and features about China's wealthy, and how they spend their money.

items.title: China faces 2026 marked by economic strains and uneasy rivalry with US: Asia Society
items.creator: Mark Magnier
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China faces 2026 marked by economic strains and uneasy rivalry with US: Asia Society
items.content:
Beijing and Washington will continue to circle each other warily in 2026 even as China’s leadership struggles to balance economic growth against its control fixation, according to a report on next year’s outlook for China released on Wednesday by the Asia Society.
“As we look towards 2026, the story is not one of rises or triumph. It’s not black or white,” said Lizzi Lee, a fellow at the Society’s Centre for China Analysis and one of the report’s co-authors. “It is a story of transitions,...

items.title: China’s sovereign wealth fund reveals it opened London office after Trump win
items.creator: Frank Tang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s sovereign wealth fund reveals it opened London office after Trump win
items.content:
China’s flagship sovereign wealth fund has revealed that it opened a representative office in London shortly after Donald Trump’s victory in last year’s US presidential election, a move made amid increased scrutiny of Chinese investments in the United States.
The London office was officially registered in December 2024, with the mission of “advancing the company’s overseas investment business” and “promoting cross-border investment cooperation”, China Investment Corporation (CIC) said in its...

items.title: Chinese supercomputer maker Sugon and chip developer Hygon call off merger plans

items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Chinese supercomputer maker Sugon and chip developer Hygon call off merger plans

images.alt: The headquarters of Sugon is at the Zhongguancun Software Park in Beijing. Photo: Handout
images.title: The headquarters of Sugon is at the Zhongguancun Software Park in Beijing. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Chinese supercomputer maker Sugon and chip designer Hygon Information Technology have called off a planned mega-merger that had been under discussion for months, in a surprise move that could complicate the country’s tech self-sufficiency efforts in the semiconductor and high-performance computing sectors.
The two Shanghai-listed companies late on Tuesday said they cancelled merger talks because “the market environment has changed significantly since the initial planning stages of this...

items.title: China’s Moore Threads to unveil AI chip road map to rival Nvidia’s CUDA system
items.creator: Ann Cao
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s Moore Threads to unveil AI chip road map to rival Nvidia’s CUDA system

images.alt: Moore Threads Technology founder, chairman and CEO Zhang Jianzhong speaks at the launch of the firm’s KUAE system, a GPU-based computing platform for AI training, in Beijing on December 19, 2023. Photo: Moore Threads
images.title: Moore Threads Technology founder, chairman and CEO Zhang Jianzhong speaks at the launch of the firm’s KUAE system, a GPU-based computing platform for AI training, in Beijing on December 19, 2023. Photo: Moore Threads

items.content:
Moore Threads Technology is set to launch its latest graphics processing unit (GPU) architecture next week, fresh from the Chinese artificial intelligence chip designer’s stellar trading debut last Friday in Shanghai.
Founder, chairman and CEO Zhang Jianzhong will unveil the Beijing-based firm’s fifth-generation GPU architecture during its inaugural MUSA Developer Conference on December 19 and 20 in the nation’s capital, according to the company’s latest post on WeChat.
MUSA refers to the firm’s...

items.title: China’s Deep Robotics raises US$70 million as sector draws more investors (原标题: China’s Deep Robotics raises US$70 million in fresh funds as sector draws more investors)
items.creator: Danielle Popov
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s Deep Robotics raises US$70 million as sector draws more investors
items.content:
Deep Robotics – one of the “Six Little Dragons” from Hangzhou, the capital of eastern Zhejiang province – on Tuesday said it had raised 500 million yuan (US$70 million) in fresh funding from a group of Chinese investors.
According to the company’s statement, its latest round of financing was led by CMB International, China Asset Management and funds under state-owned telecommunications network operators China Telecom and China Unicom.
Deep Robotics founder and CEO Zhu Qiuguo, who also serves as...

items.title: China’s AI developers to welcome Nvidia’s H200 chip shipments, analysts say (原标题: Tech war: China’s AI developers to welcome Nvidia’s H200 chip shipments, analysts say)
items.creator: Ann Cao
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s AI developers to welcome Nvidia’s H200 chip shipments, analysts say
items.content:
China’s artificial intelligence developers are expected to welcome Washington’s go-ahead for Nvidia to ship its H200 AI chips to approved customers on the mainland, according to analysts, even as Beijing continues to drive the country’s tech self-sufficiency efforts.
In a post on his Truth Social platform on Monday, US President Donald Trump said he had informed his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, of that decision “under conditions that allow for continued strong national security”. Xi had...

items.title: DeepSeek founder Liang Wenfeng cleans up on chip firm Moore Threads’ IPO (原标题: DeepSeek founder Liang Wenfeng cleans up on chip firm Moore Threads’ Shanghai IPO)
items.creator: Wency Chen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: DeepSeek founder Liang Wenfeng cleans up on chip firm Moore Threads’ IPO
items.content:
Chinese entrepreneur Liang Wenfeng, the founder and CEO of DeepSeek, appears to have made a big score from the initial public offering of chip designer Moore Threads Technology, whose shares surged more than fivefold in its trading debut in Shanghai.
High-Flyer Quantitative Fund, a hedge fund co-founded by Liang, had subscribed to a total of 82,244 shares of Moore Threads, at 114.28 yuan per share, via two entities: Zhejiang High-Flyer Asset Management and Ningbo High-Flyer Quant Investment...

items.title: New China guidelines to base asset managers’ pay on the performance of funds (原标题: New China guidelines to base asset managers’ pay on the performance of funds that they run)
items.creator: Daniel Ren
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: New China guidelines to base asset managers’ pay on the performance of funds
items.content:
China’s securities regulator has called on the country’s 160 mutual fund houses to establish a performance-based salary mechanism, as part of efforts to uproot elitism from the industry.
The China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC) has drawn up guidelines governing asset managers’ pay perks, suggesting that the performance of the funds they run should factor up to 80 per cent in determining their annual salaries, according to a report on Monday by the official Securities Times.
The...

items.title: Moore Threads shares dazzle with fivefold jump in Shanghai debut (原标题: Moore Threads shares jump fivefold in Shanghai trading debut in rush for ‘China’s Nvidia’)
items.creator: Zhang Shidong,Themis Qi
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Moore Threads shares dazzle with fivefold jump in Shanghai debut

images.alt: Moore Threads’ MTT S400 GPUs. Photo: Handout
images.title: Moore Threads’ MTT S400 GPUs. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Moore Threads Technology surged by more than fivefold in Shanghai, as enthusiastic investors vied to get shares of the Beijing-based semiconductor supplier used in artificial intelligence, helping to mark the second-biggest trading debut in China’s stock market this year.
Moore’s shares began trading at 650 yuan, a 468 per cent jump from their initial public offering (IPO) price of 114.28 yuan. The stock closed 425 per cent higher at 600.50 yuan. China’s benchmark CSI300 Index rose 0.8 per cent...

items.title: Mainland China’s billionaire count surges as BYD and Mixue bosses power gains (原标题: Mainland China’s billionaire count surges as BYD and Mixue bosses power wealth gains)
items.creator: Julie Zhang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Mainland China’s billionaire count surges as BYD and Mixue bosses power gains

images.alt: A Mixue shop in Hong Kong. Brothers Zhang Hongchao and Zhang Hongfu have joined the ultra-rich club after Mixue raised US$444 million from its Hong Kong share sale in March. Photo: Xiaohongshu
images.title: A Mixue shop in Hong Kong. Brothers Zhang Hongchao and Zhang Hongfu have joined the ultra-rich club after Mixue raised US$444 million from its Hong Kong share sale in March. Photo: Xiaohongshu

items.content:
Mainland China’s billionaires have tightened their grip as Asia-Pacific’s wealthiest after their combined fortunes swelled to nearly US$1.8 trillion, with electric-vehicle (EV) maker BYD’s founder Wang Chuanfu and bubble tea chain Mixue’s bosses among the biggest drivers of that growth, according to a UBS report.
Backed by a booming tech sector and surging asset prices, the wealth of mainland China’s billionaires jumped 22.2 per cent year on year to US$1.77 trillion in the 12 months to early...

items.title: China’s shrinking credit reflects a financial reset, not a collapse
items.creator: Kun Tian
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s shrinking credit reflects a financial reset, not a collapse
items.content:
China’s latest credit figures have raised eyebrows, but they need not raise alarm. New bank lending, aggregate social financing and total credit growth all came in weaker than expected for October, marking their softest readings in more than a year.
For markets conditioned to expect Beijing to counter every slowdown with a surge of liquidity, the numbers may suggest a worrying loss of momentum. But that reading misses the broader structural shift under way. The data reflects not a collapse, but...

items.title: Brazil’s central bank chief says China’s low-cost imports have eased inflation (原标题: Brazil’s central bank chief says inflation decreasing due to low-cost imports from China)
items.creator: Igor Patrick
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Brazil’s central bank chief says China’s low-cost imports have eased inflation
items.content:
Brazil’s central bank president, Gabriel Galipolo, said on Monday that China is exporting “disinflation or even deflation” to Brazil through a surge in low-cost imports, easing inflation.
Speaking at an economics forum in Sao Paulo, Galipolo said Brazilian imports from China have grown while their prices have fallen, easing inflation in the short term but reflecting deeper imbalances in global trade.
“It is, in a sense, offsetting an impact that would otherwise be even greater, both for the...

items.title: How China could solve its consumption conundrum
items.creator: Zhu Tian
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: How China could solve its consumption conundrum
items.content:
China’s most effective tool to revive consumption may be the simplest: a one-off distribution of 3,000 yuan (US$424) per person – funded by special sovereign bonds and valid for one year – could immediately lift demand, boost gross domestic product growth and help break the deflationary cycle that has taken hold since 2022.
This proposal comes as China prepares to announce its 15th five-year plan, with policymakers expected to target around 5 per cent growth amid a sluggish post-pandemic...

items.title: Tesla affirms confidence in Chinese partners, repudiates supplier ban (原标题: Tesla rejects ‘country-of-origin’ ban of Chinese parts suppliers, repudiates media reports)

items.translated_title: Tesla affirms confidence in Chinese partners, repudiates supplier ban

images.alt: Elon Musk is seen with vice-president Grace Tao and senior vice-president Tom Zhu in Beijing on May 31, 2023. Photo: Reuters
images.title: Elon Musk is seen with vice-president Grace Tao and senior vice-president Tom Zhu in Beijing on May 31, 2023. Photo: Reuters

items.content:
Tesla does not exclude suppliers based on their country of origin as the US electric-vehicle (EV) maker applies unified and rigorous standards in selecting vendors from around the globe, according to a senior official.
Grace Tao, vice-president of the US company, offered a vote of confidence to the more than 400 Chinese manufacturers that supply car components from batteries to heat-control systems to Tesla’s Shanghai Gigafactory.
She made the remarks on Wednesday, in what appeared to be an...

items.title: Alibaba to lead AI capital spending among Chinese firms amid strong demand (原标题: Alibaba to lead AI capital spending among China’s Big Tech firms amid strong market demand)
items.creator: Ann Cao,Bien Perez

items.translated_title: Alibaba to lead AI capital spending among Chinese firms amid strong demand
items.content:
E-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding expects to stay ahead of its Chinese Big Tech peers in artificial intelligence-related capital expenditure, as the firm’s AI and cloud computing unit posted its fourth consecutive quarter of double-digit revenue growth.
Alibaba Cloud on Tuesday reported a 34 per cent year-on-year revenue growth to 39.8 billion yuan (US$5.6 billion) in the three months ended September 30, as the Hangzhou-based parent’s overall revenue in its financial second quarter reached...

items.title: China sets strongest yuan fix in over a year as Fed-cut bets rise
items.creator: Sylvia Ma
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China sets strongest yuan fix in over a year as Fed-cut bets rise
items.content:
China’s central bank has set the yuan’s daily reference rate against the US dollar at the strongest level in more than a year, with analysts expecting room for appreciation should a December rate cut by the US Federal Reserve weaken the dollar.
The People’s Bank of China set the yuan’s midpoint rate, also known as the daily fixing rate, at 7.0796 to the US dollar on Wednesday – the strongest showing since October 2024.
The decision followed a 0.34 per cent rally in the offshore yuan on Tuesday,...

items.title: UBTech humanoid robots to patrol China-Vietnam border crossings (原标题: UBTech wins US$37 million deal to deploy humanoid robots at China-Vietnam border crossings)
items.creator: Wency Chen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: UBTech humanoid robots to patrol China-Vietnam border crossings
items.content:
UBTech Robotics, one of China’s top robot manufacturers, said on Tuesday it had secured a major contract to deploy humanoids at border crossings to perform tasks such as guiding travellers, conducting inspections and handling logistics, as the country intensified efforts to apply robotics in the real world.
The company has struck a 264 million yuan (US$37 million) deal with a humanoid robot centre in Fangchenggang, a coastal city in the southern autonomous region of Guangxi, which shares a...

items.title: Alibaba posts 5% rise in quarterly revenue on AI, cloud momentum (原标题: Alibaba posts 5% rise in quarterly revenue on AI, cloud computing momentum)
items.creator: Ann Cao,Wency Chen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Alibaba posts 5% rise in quarterly revenue on AI, cloud momentum
items.content:
Alibaba Group Holding, China’s e-commerce and cloud computing giant, on Tuesday reported a better-than-expected 5 per cent increase in revenue for the September quarter, as its cloud and artificial intelligence businesses continued to gain momentum.
Total revenue for the Hangzhou-based company reached 247.8 billion yuan (US$34.8 billion) for its financial second quarter ended September 30, beating the consensus estimate of 245.2 billion yuan by Bloomberg-polled analysts. That was more than the 2...

items.title: Huawei’s latest Kirin 9030 processor powers premium Mate 80 smartphones
items.creator: Iris Deng
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Huawei’s latest Kirin 9030 processor powers premium Mate 80 smartphones

images.alt: Richard Yu Chengdong, the chairman of Huawei Technologies’ consumer business group, shows two models of the high-end Mate 80 RS models at Tuesday’s live-streamed product launch. Photo: Handout
images.title: Richard Yu Chengdong, the chairman of Huawei Technologies’ consumer business group, shows two models of the high-end Mate 80 RS models at Tuesday’s live-streamed product launch. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Huawei Technologies on Tuesday revealed that its next-generation Kirin 9030 system-on-a-chip powers the more advanced models of its newly launched 5G Mate 80 series smartphones.
Shenzhen-based Huawei listed the Kirin 9030 as the processor for the 12-gigabyte random access memory (RAM) version of the Mate 80 Pro, while its Kirin 9030 Pro version is built into the 16GB RAM Mate 80 Pro, the Mate 80 Pro Max and Mate 80 RS models, according to the official website for the company’s latest flagship...

items.title: Wingtech says Nexperia’s headquarters remains silent on call for talks (原标题: Nexperia’s Chinese owner Wingtech says Dutch headquarters remains silent on call for talks)
items.creator: Danielle Popov
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Wingtech says Nexperia’s headquarters remains silent on call for talks
items.content:
Wingtech Technology, the Chinese owner of Nexperia, said it had received no meaningful reply after reaching out to the Dutch chipmaker’s headquarters for talks.
“It is deeply regrettable and puzzling that, despite our utmost sincerity, the Dutch side of Nexperia has not made any substantive response to our proposal for communication,” Wingtech said on Sunday.
The Shanghai-listed company did not disclose the details of its outreach efforts, but urged Nexperia’s headquarters to present “a...
